column5: Large butterfly with brightly colored wings.
It flies elegantly with its long tail and wings,
and lives by feeding on nectar.
Medium-size butterfly with white wings. As its caterpillar
the cabbageworm, they eat rape blossoms and other leaves.
They emerge from their chrysalis in spring.
Orange butterfly with a leopard pattern on its wings.
In the heat of the summer season, they stop moving
They prefer rotting fruits and animal corpses.
With a triangular head, males make a
Large grasshopper living mainly in grassy plains.
When there is not much food, they swarm and
Predatory insect with large sickle-shaped forelegs.
Capturing and eating various insects with quick
movements, it is king of the grassy plains.
Nocturnal insect living mainly in warm areas.
In fall, males rub their wings together,
Large cicada with a black sturdy body.
With a grand ringing call in summer, their
lifespan is exhausted with the end of summer.
Large cicada living in northern regions and dense mountains.
Perching upside down on tree bark,
gii, gii is their monotone call.
Cicada active from summer to fall. Because you
can hear their "tsuku tsuku boushi" cry,
that is how they get their Japanese common
cicada has no common name in English.
Cicada living in forests of Japanese cypress and cedar.
From summer to fall, their sad
Large dragonfly with striped black and yellow body pattern.
Though it is wild, showing it a twirling finger will lure it.
Small dragonfly that lives near water.
When it stops on a leaf, it gently folds its
wings, appearing like a single thread.
Dragonfly with crimson body and wings.
When mating, the male and female couple and
take flight. Popularly called the red dragonfly.
Small dragonfly with shining black and blue wings.
Though they can only live near water, they
flutter like butterflies when they fly.
Large rhinocerous beetle that prefers the sap of
sawtooth oak. Males grow a horn that looks
like a hoe, that changes the shape of its jaw.
Rhinocerous beetle that grows a horn that looks like a saw.
Though it has a belligerent nature, when it receives
a shock, it pretends to be dead and falls.
Species of rhinocerous beetle with a long antenna.
Giant rhinocerous beetle boasting a super-heavy weight.
Though it feeds on nectar and pollen, it is the
Large rhinoceros beetle crowned with the name of a legendary
hero. Has one large horn. As the name says, it is king of the
forest, boasting the largest size class among all insects.
Large rhinoceros beetle with a characteristic
three-pronged horn. Though it lives in the high
mountain zone, it has a fierce belligerence and
equals the hercules beetle as the strongest
Extra-large rhinoceros beetle with a heavy body weight.
Though when it is an adult, it is too large to be placed
on one hand, it lives by feeding on sap.
With a large body and strong legs, it is an exemplar
rhinoceros beetle. The horn that males have is split
in two, and is seen as a decorative helmet.
Because their caterpillars make beautiful, green-tinged
cocoons, humans keep them as pets.
Small social insects that live in large groups.
Though they store honey in their nest, enemies
can't easily approach due to their sharp stingers.
Insect that flies about with quick movements.
In addition to eating fruits and feces, their larva,
called maggots, appear on animal corpses.
The sound made by the wings of this flying insect is grating
to the ears. The females stick humans and animals, sucking
their blood, and sometimes spread infectious disease.
Arthropod that lives in wasteland and arid regions.
Has a stinger containing deadly poison on its tail,
which can easily kill a human.
Large spider living in tropical regions.
With a hairy body, it walks around on the surface,
and holds poison in its strong fangs.
Has the strange character of rolling animal dung into
balls and transporting them to its nest for use as food.
The larva of the ant lion (paradise dragonfly).
Makes a nest in dry sandy soil in the shape of a mortar,
eating insects that fall into it.
